---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: I just noted that in `Mathlib.RingTheory.DedekindDomain.Different` there a lot of results where `A` and `K` are implicit but they should be explicit (this can very well be my fault, sorry), can you please fix it (you can just do it in this PR)?

:v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7263871869/job/19790140113)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7263871869/job/19790139129)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7263871869/job/19790139382)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion {I : FractionalIdeal B L} (hI : I 0) [NoZeroSMulDivisors A B] : ```
Looking at Mathlib.RingTheory.DedekindDomain.Ideal I have the impression we use `` rather than `1 /`, you can maybe do the same (but feel to keep `1 / ` if you have a good reason to do so).
I did this so that we don't need an `[IsDedekindDomain B]` instance considering your comment on the last PR.

Do you think it is worth to use [InvolutiveStar](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Star/Basic.html#InvolutiveStar) here? For example we get injectivity from the general machinery.
I don't think this is possible since it requires a choice of `A` and `K`. And the `Function.Involutive.injective` used below is probably the general machinery.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Define the different ideal.

nodes.body: I just noted that in `Mathlib.RingTheory.DedekindDomain.Different` there a lot of results where `A` and `K` are implicit but they should be explicit (this can very well be my fault, sorry), can you please fix it (you can just do it in this PR)?
